channel.title: A simple, but proven way to lose pounds!
channel.description:
I heard this the other day, and people were talking about losing weight. It has been proven that if you drink ice cold water or spicy food, you lose weight.
Anyone up for a discussion on this?

item.title: A simple, but proven way to lose pounds!
item.dc:creator: @Fishstix Fishstix
item.description:
@Fishstix wrote:

People usually water fast, but not more than a month because i’m pretty sure it starts to damage your kidneys, then they slowly start to break it with a fruit/vegtable fast and then move into harder exercies and more meat products

Read full topic

item.title: A simple, but proven way to lose pounds!
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

On another topic

Laughing my fucking ass off. All of this retardedness. You aren’t going to loose weight by drinking cold water or spicy food. It might be something phsycological, like it make you stop wanting to eat because of some pains. But it isn’t going to burn fat in any way.

That’s been established.

Im surprised nobody mentioned this

And about the spicy stuff, they say it’s good for having sex.

I wan’t my bread toastedbut alsountoasted

I mean is that physically possible?

And nothing beats good ol’ fashion exercise the BEST way how I lose weight is just play sports with friends its fun you can be running for hours and never even relies it since your having fun then bring water/Vitamin water with you thats what I do.
[/quote]No it’s fucking boring. Personal Excercise is fun, sports suck ass. I hate competing.

no one here has friends

item.title: A simple, but proven way to lose pounds!
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Hippie_Slay, post:38, topic:233237”]Dumb idea. If you don’t eat your body will go into starvation mode in which it will conserve as many calories as possible thinking that there never will be more.
You should try having 5 meals a day if you are on a diet that is. Eat very little but eat a lot. I promise the weight will come off in a flash as long as you stick too it.[/quote]

That’s like driving fast but slow.

Read full topic

item.title: A simple, but proven way to lose pounds!
item.dc:creator: @Hippie_Slay Hippie_Slay
item.description:
@Hippie_Slay wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

or you could just put down the fork

Dumb idea. If you don’t eat your body will go into starvation mode in which it will conserve as many calories as possible thinking that there never will be more.
You should try having 5 meals a day if you are on a diet that is. Eat very little but eat a lot. I promise the weight will come off in a flash as long as you stick too it.

Yz85Racer:

Or you could just hang a massive shit.

In order to “hang a massive shit” you have to eat a decent amount thus defeating the purpose of losing weight in the first place.

item.source: A simple, but proven way to lose pounds!

item.title: A simple, but proven way to lose pounds!
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:36, topic:233237”]What I do is wear very light clothes, spend time in cold rooms, etc. As I see things, the colder we are, the more fat we have to burn to maintain our internal body temperature.

So far; this seems to be the case.[/quote]

On the other hand, the warmer you are, the more you sweat and thus the more body fluids you lose. So you lose weight too.

Read full topic

item.source: A simple, but proven way to lose pounds!

item.title: A simple, but proven way to lose pounds!
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“vraj82192, post:34, topic:233237”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=307578.msg2537438#msg2537438 date=1226817328]

I’m not sure about the spicy food.

However drinking a lot of water is really good because it keeps your body hydrated, it flushes your system of excess stuff (thus the potential for weightloss), and it can also fill you up a bit. If you’re working out and actually trying to lose weight then you should be drinking 16+ glasses (at least double the usual recommendation) per day.

Another important thing when trying to lose weight is the way you eat. Many people rush eating, and in doing so they eat excessively. By eating a bit slower you give your body the chance to tell you that you’re full.

Small meals are good for this reason, but it’s often a hard transition to make if you rely on your parents for meals. 6 small meals a day ensure that you have energy but don’t overindulge. You should be having something small every 2 hours or so.
Generally speaking, a piece of fruit every 2 hours will get you by. You can also eat things like nuts, oatmeal (or something else that’s grainy in nature). Avoid overly processed cereals, because they’re crap.

I’m sure there are more approaches, but I can’t be bothered listing them. It’s all about the types of foods you eat though.
For example, you should have things like bananas and apples in the earlier portion of the day because their carbohydrate chains are ‘simpler’ in nature when compared to the carbohydrates in foods like lettuce and broccoli.

EDIT: Oh, and bread is probably best avoided if you want to lose weight quickly. Yeah, it’s a staple meal in the lives of most people, but it’s also not the best (unless full grain, preferably as grainy as possible). White bread is absolutely a no-go zone if you’re serious about getting fit, because it’s just rubbish.

Very true.

Most kids in America eat lunch at school and out of all the schools I have attended, the maximum lunch break was 30 minutes. That is about fifteen minutes getting your lunch and then fifteen minutes to eat it, so most kids eat their lunches pretty quickly. Fifteen minutes is not enough time for your body to tell your brain that you are full, so most people tend to over eat.

Also, try to avoid watching T.V. while you are eating, a lot of times you aren’t aware that you are eating because your so into what your watching.

I’m Indian so I live off spicy food and it tastes great, but don’t expect to loose weight from it.

…I take it you work at Optus?
[/quote]

No idea what that is, but if its some stereotyping like owning a gas station or working at Dairy Queen… then YES ;P[/quote]
I’m sorry, I was being a cunt. Optus is an Australian ISP, except every time you go to ring them, you get an Indian

Read full topic

I’m not sure about the spicy food.

However drinking a lot of water is really good because it keeps your body hydrated, it flushes your system of excess stuff (thus the potential for weightloss), and it can also fill you up a bit. If you’re working out and actually trying to lose weight then you should be drinking 16+ glasses (at least double the usual recommendation) per day.

Another important thing when trying to lose weight is the way you eat. Many people rush eating, and in doing so they eat excessively. By eating a bit slower you give your body the chance to tell you that you’re full.

Small meals are good for this reason, but it’s often a hard transition to make if you rely on your parents for meals. 6 small meals a day ensure that you have energy but don’t overindulge. You should be having something small every 2 hours or so.
Generally speaking, a piece of fruit every 2 hours will get you by. You can also eat things like nuts, oatmeal (or something else that’s grainy in nature). Avoid overly processed cereals, because they’re crap.

I’m sure there are more approaches, but I can’t be bothered listing them. It’s all about the types of foods you eat though.
For example, you should have things like bananas and apples in the earlier portion of the day because their carbohydrate chains are ‘simpler’ in nature when compared to the carbohydrates in foods like lettuce and broccoli.

EDIT: Oh, and bread is probably best avoided if you want to lose weight quickly. Yeah, it’s a staple meal in the lives of most people, but it’s also not the best (unless full grain, preferably as grainy as possible). White bread is absolutely a no-go zone if you’re serious about getting fit, because it’s just rubbish.

Very true.

Most kids in America eat lunch at school and out of all the schools I have attended, the maximum lunch break was 30 minutes. That is about fifteen minutes getting your lunch and then fifteen minutes to eat it, so most kids eat their lunches pretty quickly. Fifteen minutes is not enough time for your body to tell your brain that you are full, so most people tend to over eat.

Also, try to avoid watching T.V. while you are eating, a lot of times you aren’t aware that you are eating because your so into what your watching.

I’m Indian so I live off spicy food and it tastes great, but don’t expect to loose weight from it.
[/quote]
…I take it you work at Optus?[/quote]

No idea what that is, but if its some stereotyping like owning a gas station or working at Dairy Queen… then YES

However drinking a lot of water is really good because it keeps your body hydrated, it flushes your system of excess stuff (thus the potential for weightloss), and it can also fill you up a bit. If you’re working out and actually trying to lose weight then you should be drinking 16+ glasses (at least double the usual recommendation) per day.

Another important thing when trying to lose weight is the way you eat. Many people rush eating, and in doing so they eat excessively. By eating a bit slower you give your body the chance to tell you that you’re full.

Small meals are good for this reason, but it’s often a hard transition to make if you rely on your parents for meals. 6 small meals a day ensure that you have energy but don’t overindulge. You should be having something small every 2 hours or so.

item.title: A simple, but proven way to lose pounds!
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I’m not sure about the spicy food.

However drinking a lot of water is really good because it keeps your body hydrated, it flushes your system of excess stuff (thus the potential for weightloss), and it can also fill you up a bit. If you’re working out and actually trying to lose weight then you should be drinking 16+ glasses (at least double the usual recommendation) per day.

Another important thing when trying to lose weight is the way you eat. Many people rush eating, and in doing so they eat excessively. By eating a bit slower you give your body the chance to tell you that you’re full.

Small meals are good for this reason, but it’s often a hard transition to make if you rely on your parents for meals. 6 small meals a day ensure that you have energy but don’t overindulge. You should be having something small every 2 hours or so.
Generally speaking, a piece of fruit every 2 hours will get you by. You can also eat things like nuts, oatmeal (or something else that’s grainy in nature). Avoid overly processed cereals, because they’re crap.

I’m sure there are more approaches, but I can’t be bothered listing them. It’s all about the types of foods you eat though.
For example, you should have things like bananas and apples in the earlier portion of the day because their carbohydrate chains are ‘simpler’ in nature when compared to the carbohydrates in foods like lettuce and broccoli.

EDIT: Oh, and bread is probably best avoided if you want to lose weight quickly. Yeah, it’s a staple meal in the lives of most people, but it’s also not the best (unless full grain, preferably as grainy as possible). White bread is absolutely a no-go zone if you’re serious about getting fit, because it’s just rubbish.

Read full topic
item.source: A simple, but proven way to lose pounds!

item.title: A simple, but proven way to lose pounds!
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:27, topic:233237”]Too be honest, I don’t see why so many fat shits complain that they can’t get fit, if you want to get fit you’ve got to make it happen. Like a friend of mine who has bigger boobs than Silab, and he’s MALE!!! said he wanted to get fit and come and train with me, so I offered for him to come to the gym with me and do a workout which I normally do for kickboxing, normally consists of some weights, but more running.

I run for about 10kms, fluctuating between a faster run and a jog, a lot of people ask me how I stay motivated and my motivation is my racing - since I’m not racing in my class anymore, and will be the only 14 year old in 125A, I want to make a name for myself and come into it as hard as I can, so I’m going to need to be at the top of my game physically.

People sometimes train better by themselves, but I use the motivation of competition to train and work my arse off.[/quote]

Shame you have bigger tits than your mother and you have celulite streaming out of every possible exit.

Read full topic

item.title: A simple, but proven way to lose pounds!
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Too be honest, I don’t see why so many fat shits complain that they can’t get fit, if you want to get fit you’ve got to make it happen. Like a friend of mine who has bigger boobs than Silab, and he’s MALE!!! said he wanted to get fit and come and train with me, so I offered for him to come to the gym with me and do a workout which I normally do for kickboxing, normally consists of some weights, but more running.

I run for about 10kms, fluctuating between a faster run and a jog, a lot of people ask me how I stay motivated and my motivation is my racing - since I’m not racing in my class anymore, and will be the only 14 year old in 125A, I want to make a name for myself and come into it as hard as I can, so I’m going to need to be at the top of my game physically.

People sometimes train better by themselves, but I use the motivation of competition to train and work my arse off.
